intro: Rhynchosia pulchella, commonly known as the golden crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble a crown. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets and produces elongated pods that contain kidney-shaped seeds. Rhynchosia pulchella is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
